__e: For months now,I've been hung up on looking for my dad and blaming my mom... and it's gotten me nowhere.
I'm sorry, Captain, but it appears that everything you went through... was meaningless.
Because I'm beginning to think this whole thing was a fool's errand.
Is this the knife you used to kill my mother?
So the same gun was used to kill both men.
It was used to kill your wife.
For months now,I've been hung up on looking for my dad and blaming my mom... and it's gotten me nowhere.
Because I'm beginning to think this whole thing was a fool's errand.
I'm sorry, Captain, but it appears that everything you went through... was meaningless.
And all this time, he's been using it to keep you under his thumb.
Your father and I were using it for something.
I don't wanna know when they retired this thing.
If I was to stand before her and tell her how he used me.
You used me, made me a sucker, and that hurts me, because I would've done anything for you.
You used me to get a lot of free publicity.
Find out if it was enid or the unsub using her credit card.
Maybe there was a fourth person Or maybe someone used the car before them
That guy, the one who tells you things he used you and let you rot like a piece of garbage.
You used me to get a lot of free publicity.
I used my wife, my kids, my friends.
I didn't know you'd served in the army.
Besides, it's nice to give a little something back to the guys who served, you know?
Wait, he said that he served in the military?
We served in the same unit three years ago.
Seventeen years, I served the Metro Police.
You were in the Red Guards!
Besides, it's nice to give a little something back to the guys who served, you know?
Any luck, it was used in another crime.
I've done it myself and I've gotten away with it, too.
I can't believe I served with that guy.
Hey. I've waited tables with you for four years and there's no way you could call what you do working.
What he did was terribly wrong, I know that now but I'm still proud to have served with him.
It's crap you gave me along the way.
Just a guy who served you coffee once.
"Our pleasure," in the sense that he had nothing to do with it.
